text: Dennis Gail Peters (April 17, 1937 â€“ April 13, 2020) was an American analytical chemist. He worked in electrochemistry and was named the Herman T. Briscoe Professor at Indiana University in 1975. Peters' research focused on the electrochemical behavior of halogenated organic compounds. He authored over 210 publications and 5 analytical chemistry textbooks. He was born in Los Angeles, California. Peters died of COVID-19 on April 13, 2020 in Bloomington, Indiana at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States Category:Scientists from Los Angeles Category:Scientists from Indiana Category:Writers from Los Angeles Category:Indiana University faculty Category:People from Bloomington, Indiana
title: Dennis G. Peters
